alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued May 19 at 7:10AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR WILDFIRE SMOKE FROM 600 AM FRIDAY UNTIL 400 PM FRIDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke. WHERE...Sedgwick, Logan, Larimer, Weld, Morgan, Boulder, Broomfield, Washington, Adams, Denver, Arapahoe, Jefferson, Douglas, Elbert, Kit Carson, Lincoln, Cheyenne, El Paso, Phillips, Yuma, Gilpin and Clear Creek Counties. Locations include, but are not limited to Julesburg, Sterling, Fort Collins, Greeley, Fort Morgan, Boulder, Broomfield, Akron, Brighton, Denver, Deer Trail, Littleton, Golden, Castle Rock, Kiowa, Burlington, Limon, Cheyenne Wells, Colorado Springs, Holyoke, Wray, Central City and Georgetown. WHEN...600 AM Friday May 19 to 400 PM Friday May 19 IMPACTS...Moderate to heavy smoke transported from Canadian wildfires will impact the advisory area through at least Friday afternoon. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: Increasing likelihood of respiratory symptoms in sensitive individuals, aggravation of heart or lung disease and premature mortality in people with cardiopulmonary disease and older adults. People with heart or lung disease, older adults, and children should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion.
